results.title: Whales
results.brief_description: WHALES - a film as big, beautiful and complex as its subjects. Throughout history the destinies of men and whales have been closely linked. From primitive peoples, pitted against these mighty creatures with just a harpoon and cunning, whaling meant survival. In the 19th century whaling epitomised adventure, excitement and discovery. Today, whaling means big business, power and money. Now its the whales who excite our curiosity and demand our compassion. “Whales” is a thought-provoking look at our complex feelings of love, hate, necessity and fear towards the animals who share our planet as we struggle to balance our needs against their survival.

results.title: Whale Song Whales and Dolphins of the Pacific
results.brief_description: Whalesong is a tribute to the majesty and grace of singing, dancing, ancient mammals that have graced our planet for 50 million years … and yet are still endangered by senseless slaughter and ocean pollution. “Whalesong” will inspire awe, love and empathy for the whales and dolphins by allowing you to feel a part of their world. Lloyd Bridges is our escort and guide to the people that live in the sea.

results.title: Whale rider. Cracker bag
results.creator_credit: Glendyn Ivin, Niki Caro, Jane Liscombe, Frank Hubner, John Barnett, Tim Sanders, Exit Films, Ruby Films, Outerspace, Pandora Films, Apollo Media and South Pacific Pictures
results.brief_description: Whale Rider: Set in a small village in rural New Zealand, “Whale Rider” is the story of a Maori community who are looking for a new male heir as leader. All looks certain until the heir apparent and his mother die at childbirth leaving his twin, Pai, a baby girl. Pai (Keisha Castle-Hughes) has to overcome 1000 years of tradition and the fierce determination of her beloved grandfather to assert her rightful place as leader and re-unite her people. Beautiful landscapes, moody music and underwater photography add to the lush look of this film. Internationally acclaimed and multi-award winning feature film. Based on the novel “The Whale Rider” by Witi Ihmaera. “Cracker bag”: Personal childhood memories are evoked when watching this Australian short about a young girl, Eddie, as she saves her money to buy fireworks for Guy Fawkes Night. Set in the 1980s, “Cracker Bag” is a tender suburban study that finely depicts a disheartening pivotal moment in the life of a young girl. Photographic-like in its 35mm presentation, “Cracker bag” is deservedly Winner of the Palme D’Or (Short Film) Festival De Cannes 2003 and many other accolades. Written and directed by Glendyn Ivin, starring young Edith Cattell as Eddie.

results.title: Whale Rider
results.brief_description: Whale Rider is a 2002 New Zealand-German family drama film written and directed by Niki Caro, starring Keisha Castle-Hughes as Kahu Paikea Apirana, a 12-year-old Māori girl whose ambition is to become the chief of the tribe.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

results.description: On the east coast of New Zealand, the Whangara people believe their presence there dates back a thousand years or more to a single ancestor, Paikea, who escaped death when his canoe capsized by riding to shore on the back of a whale. From then on, Whangara chiefs, always the first-born, always male, have been considered Paikea’s direct descendants. Pai, an 11-year-old girl in a patriarchal New Zealand tribe, believes she is destined to be the new chief. But her grandfather Koro is bound by tradition to pick a male leader. Pai loves Koro more than anyone in the world, but she must fight him and a thousand years of tradition to fulfill her destiny.
description_for_label: On the east coast of New Zealand, the Whangara people believe their presence there dates back a thousand years or more to a single ancestor, Paikea, who escaped death when his canoe capsized by riding to shore on the back of a whale. results.title: Whale hunting
results.creator_credit: Mosha Michael, Peter Raymont and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An interesting and informative journey with six Inuit hunters in their hunt of the Beluga whale near Frobisher Bay, N.W.T. We learn about the methods used in pursuing the whale and dividing the carcass.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mosha Michael, Peter Raymont and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Whale bait
results.brief_description: A whale’s strategy for dealing with fishing fleets and scientific research. The film makes a simple and effective statement on the struggle between man and nature.

results.title: Wet earth and warm people (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Candid glimpses of Indonesia and its people, in and around the capital, Jakarta. Following where chance leads, the film captures the flavour of life in this fertile crescent of tropical islands as it focuses on the Indonesian people caught between the past and the conflicting options of the future - to change or not to change from long-established patterns of life to ones more influenced by western technology. Awards: Melbourne, Atlanta, San Francisco and Toronto.

results.title: Westworld
results.creator_credit: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.description: Westworld combines solid entertainment and chilling topicality with a futuristic, suspenseful plot written by Michael Chrichton. Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines. Westworld is one of three giant theme parks built in what is left of America’s great outdoors where for $1,000 a day, tourists may indulge their highest and lowest appetites. Richard Benjamin and James Brolin are among the visitors to the futuristic theme park where the gun-hands and dance-hall girls are robots programmed to serve the guest’s whims and fantasises until something malfunctions in their circuitry. Yul Brynner delivers a remarkably eerie performance as a robot cowboy who develops a taste for the kill.
description_for_label: Westworld combines solid entertainment and chilling topicality with a futuristic, suspenseful plot written by Michael Chrichton. results.title: Westworld
results.brief_description: A dark odyssey about the dawn of artificial consciousness and the evolution of sin, set at the intersection of the near future and the reimagined past, Westworld explores a world in which every human appetite, noble or depraved, can be indulged.

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.
